intro: Litsea bainingensis, commonly known as the Baining litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the Pacific islands of the Bismarck Archipelago, including the islands of New Britain and New Ireland. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are small drupes that mature to a dark purple color, containing a single seed. Litsea bainingensis is often found in moist, lowland forests and plays a role in the local ecosystem as a source of food for various wildlife species.
